intro: Dorstenia tubicina, commonly known as the tuberculate dwarf banana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Musaceae, which includes other well-known plants like bananas and plantains. The plant is characterized by its compact, often tuberous stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
